items.title: Ecosystem relocation on Snowball Earth: Polar−alpine ancestry of the extant surface biosphere?
items.description:
Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, Volume 122, Issue 20, May 2025.
Geological observations informed by climate dynamics imply that the oceans were 99.9% covered by light-blocking ice shelves during two discrete, self-reversing Snowball Earth epochs spanning a combined 60 to 70 Myr of the Cryogenian Period (720 to 635 Ma)...

items.title: Interpreting dynamic-compression experiments to uncover the time dependence of freezing: Application to gallium
items.description:
Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, Volume 122, Issue 20, May 2025.

items.title: A founding father of neuroscience: Floyd E. Bloom, 1936–2025
items.description:

items.title: A vetiver-specific terpene synthase VzTPS9 contributes to the high attractiveness of vetiver to rice stem borer
items.description:
Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, Volume 122, Issue 20, May 2025.
SignificanceVetiver (Vetiveria zizanioides), native to Thailand and Java, is highly attractive to the rice stem borer (Chilo suppressalis, RSB), a major rice pest in Asia. As a result, it is widely used as an effective trap plant for controlling RSB in ...
